CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1939, pg. 18, reads: "Gaines Funeral Home Reflects 'The World of Tomorrow' Most Modern Equipment Plus Scientific, Efficient Service Marks New Step Forward ... Pictures reading top left to right: ... PRIVATE OFFICE - George W. Gaines has practised in Western Pennsylvania for the last 20 years. He graduated from Eckles College of Embalming in Philadelphia in 1914.  He is a native of Suffolk, Va., son of the late Rev. W. W. and Lula Gaines... THE FUNERAL services may be held in home, in the church or in Gaines' well appointed chapel.  Complete arrangements for the services will be made by one of the staff, including the minister of the family's choice, the music and musicians and even the pallbearers, if desired.- Photos by Harris ... George W. Gaines, Director of Funerals ... 220 Auburn Street, E. E., Pittsburgh, Pa."Cutline of image published in Flash Newspicture Magazine, January 1, 1939, pg. 10, reads: "Mortician - Actively engaged as a successful mortician in Pittsburgh, Pa. is Mr. George Gaines.  He is the only undertaker in this vicinity who has his own casket display room.  Mr. Gaine's [Gaines'] establishment is located in Homestead, Pa." [actually located in East End, Pittsburgh]
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George W. Gaines holding telephone and seated desk, in office of Gaines Funeral Home
